member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Barcode.BarcodeBase.ShowChecksum
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines whether the checksum will be displayed at the end of the text.
member.value: true if the checksum is displayed at the end of the text; otherwise false. The default is true.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Barcode.BarcodeBase.RenderChecksum
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines whether the checksum should be included in the barcode's image. By default this property is set to true. Scanning barcodes with most of the standards will be possible only when they include checksum. You could use this property to turn off the auto calculated checksum if you have already calculated it yourself and passed it as part of the property.
member.value: true if the checksum should be included in the barcode's image; otherwise false. The default is true.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Barcode.BarcodeBase.ShowText
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines whether the text will be displayed.
member.value: true if the text is displayed; otherwise false. The default is true.

member.name: T:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadBarcode25Interleaved
member.summary: Interleaved 2 of 5 is a higher-density numeric bar code based upon the Standard 2 of 5. Interleaved 2 of 5 encodes any even number of numeric characters in the widths of the bars and spaces of the bar code. Unlike Standard 2 of 5, which only encodes information in the width of the bars, Interleaved 2 of 5 encodes data in the width of both the bars and spaces. This allows Interleaved 2 of 5 to achieve a somewhat higher density. The code is called "interleaved" because the first numeric data is encoded in the first 5 bars while the second numeric data is encoded in the first 5 spaces that separate the first 5 bars. Thus the first 5 bars and spaces actually encode two characters. This is also why the bar code can only encode an even number of data elements.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Raises the event. This method is invoked whenever is set to true internally.
member.param: The that contains the event data.

member.name: T:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadBarcode25Standard
member.summary: Standard 2 of 5 is a low-density numeric bar code. The spaces in the barcode exist only to separate the bars themselves. Additionally, a bar may either be wide or narrow, a wide bar generally being 3 times as wide as a narrow bar. The exact size of the spaces is not critical, but is generally the same width as a narrow bar.

member.name: T:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadBarcode93
member.summary: Code 93 was designed to complement and improve upon Code 39. Code 93 is similar in that it, like Code 39, can represent the full ASCII character set by using combinations of 2 characters. It differs in that Code 93 is a continuous barcode and produces denser code. It also encodes 47 characters compared to Code 39's 43 characters.

member.name: T:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadHorizontalBulletGraph
member.summary: The control is a variation of linear gauge. It combines a number of indicators, as well as the data indicator, into one control, which is light weight, easily customizable and straightforward to setup and use. The control is a great tool for dashboards as it is the optimal way to present a lot of information in relatively small size.

member.summary: The control is a variation of linear gauge. It combines a number of indicators, as well as the data indicator, into one control, which is light weight, easily customizable and straightforward to setup and use. The control is a great tool for dashboards as it is the optimal way to present a lot of information in relatively small size.

member.summary: Normalizes the value in correspondence to the and .
member.remarks: For example, the normalized value of 140 is 0.4 if the minimum is 100 and maximum is 200. The normalized value of 1120 is 1.2 if the minimum is 1000 and maximum is 1100.
member.param: The value that is to be normalized.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadDataBarBase.NormalizeAndCoerceValue(System.Double)
member.summary: Normalizes the value in correspondence to the minimum and maximum and coerces it to be a number between 0 and 1.
member.remarks: For instance the normalized value of 1120 is 1.0 if the minimum is 1000 and maximum is 1100. The normalized value of 1000 is 0.0 if the minimum is 2000 and maximum is 3000.
member.param: The value that is to be normalized and coerced.

member.summary: Gets or sets format of the indicator's tooltip.
member.remarks: The format string can use properties of the scale objects. For example "{Value|F2} Range: Min={Range.Min|F2} Max={Range.Max|F2}". This format string uses value of the indicator and Min and Max properties of the gauge range this indicator is pointing to. Currently you can use Range and Scale objects in the format string. The '|' character is used to separate property name and its output format.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Gauge.IndicatorData.Item(System.String)
member.summary: Gets value from object using format string.
member.remarks: The format string can use properties of the scale objects. For example "{Value|F2} Range: Min={Range.Min|F2} Max={Range.Max|F2}". This format string uses value of the scale object and Min and Max properties of the gauge range this object belongs to. Currently you can use Range and Scale objects in the format string. The '|' character is used to separate property name and its output format.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Gauge.GaugeRange.TooltipFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets the format of the range tooltip.
member.remarks: The format string can use properties of the scale objects. For example "{Value|F2} Range: Min={Range.Min|F2} Max={Range.Max|F2}". This format string uses value of the indicator and Min and Max properties of the gauge range this indicator is pointing to. Currently you can use Range and Scale objects in the format string. The '|' character is used to separate property name and its output format.

member.summary: Gets or sets the style applied to the toolTip of the range.

member.summary: Gets or sets template of the range's tooltip.

member.summary: Gets or sets visibility of the gauge range.

member.summary: Gets or sets group this range belongs to.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Gauge.GaugeRange.Item(System.String)
member.summary: Gets value from object using format string.
member.remarks: The format string can use properties of the scale objects. For example "{Value|F2} Range: Min={Range.Min|F2} Max={Range.Max|F2}". This format string uses value of the indicator and Min and Max properties of the gauge range this indicator is pointing to. Currently you can use Range and Scale objects in the format string. The '|' character is used to separate property name and its output format.

member.name: T:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Gauge.ScaleObjectDataConverter
member.summary: Value converter to access scale object data properties from XAML. 2-way binding can't be specified.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Gauge.ScaleObjectDataConverter.Convert(System.Object,System.Type,System.Object,System.Globalization.CultureInfo)
member.summary: Converts a value.
member.param: The value produced by the binding source.
The type of the binding target property.

The converter parameter to use. It can be specified in a few different ways:
Simple name of the extended property.
Formatted extended property. For example: "SUM_SQMI_A|F2". The '|' character is used to separate extended property name and its output format.
Format string which can use number of the extended properties. For example: "{CNTRY_NAME} Miles: {SUM_SQMI_A|F2}, KM: {SUM_SQKM_A|F1}".
The culture to use in the converter.
member.returns: A converted value. If the method returns null (Nothing in Visual Basic), the valid null value is used.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Gauge.ScaleObjectDataConverter.ConvertBack(System.Object,System.Type,System.Object,System.Globalization.CultureInfo)
member.summary: Converts a binding target value to the source binding values.
member.param: The value that the binding target produces.
The array of types to convert to. The array length indicates the number and types of values that are suggested for the method to return.
The culture to use in the converter.
member.returns: An array of values that have been converted from the target value back to the source values.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Gauge.ScaleObjectDataConverter.GetFormattedValue(Telerik.Windows.Controls.Gauge.IScaleObjectWithTooltip,System.String)
member.summary: Get values from the scale object according to the format string.

member.name: T:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Gauge.ScaleObjectLocation
member.summary: Position of the scale object (like tick or label) relative to the scale bar.

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Gauge.ScaleObjectLocation.Outside
member.summary: The object is located outside the scale circle for radial gauges, and to the left of the scale bar for linear gauge.

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Gauge.ScaleObjectLocation.OverOutside
member.summary: The object is located over the scale. Bound to the outside or left border of the scale bar.

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Gauge.ScaleObjectLocation.OverCenter
member.summary: The object is located over the scale. Centered in the scale bar.

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Gauge.ScaleObjectLocation.OverInside
member.summary: The object is located over the scale. Bound to the inside or right border of the scale bar.

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Gauge.ScaleObjectLocation.CenterOutside
member.summary: The object is located over the scale. Bound to the scale bar center and extended to the outside or to the left of the scale bar.

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Gauge.ScaleObjectLocation.CenterInside
member.summary: The object is located over the scale. Bound to the scale bar center and extended to the inside or to the right of the scale bar.

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Gauge.ScaleObjectLocation.Inside
member.summary: The object is located inside the scale circle for radial gauges, and to the right of the scale bar for linear gauge.

member.remarks: The format string can use properties of the scale objects. For example "{Value|F2} Range: Min={Range.Min|F2} Max={Range.Max|F2}". This format string uses value of the indicator and Min and Max properties of the gauge range this indicator is pointing to. Currently you can use Range and Scale objects in the format string. The '|' character is used to separate property name and its output format.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Gauge.TickMark.Item(System.String)
member.summary: Gets value from object using format string.
member.remarks: The format string can use properties of the scale objects. For example "{Value|F2} Range: Min={Range.Min|F2} Max={Range.Max|F2}". This format string uses value of the indicator and Min and Max properties of the gauge range this indicator is pointing to. Currently you can use Range and Scale objects in the format string. The '|' character is used to separate property name and its output format.

member.name: T:Telerik.Windows.Controls.HeatMap.HeatMapDesaturationColorizer
member.summary: A desaturation colorizer. This colorizer will define the color for the cells of the in correspondence to the property.
member.remarks: The color for the cell with minimum value will be White and the color for the cell with maximum value will be . The colors for the values between the minimum and maximum will be transfused between these two colors. This can be controlled by setting the and properties. Additionally more precise control can be gained by setting the and properties.

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Controls.HeatMap.HeatMapDesaturationColorizer.StartColorProperty
member.summary: Identifies the dependency property.

member.summary: Identifies the dependency property.

member.summary: Identifies the dependency property.

member.summary: Identifies the dependency property.

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Controls.HeatMap.HeatMapDesaturationColorizer.RangeMaximumProperty
member.summary: Identifies the dependency property.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.HeatMap.HeatMapDesaturationColorizer.StartColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the start color. The cells with maximal values will be given this color. The colors for the rest of the values will be a transfusion between this color and White.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.HeatMap.HeatMapDesaturationColorizer.From
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines how vivid the color for the maximal value will be.
member.remarks: The default value for this property is 1 and the maximal values are shown with the . For instance if the value of this property is 0.9 the maximal values will be show with a color that is a slight transfusion between the and White.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.HeatMap.HeatMapDesaturationColorizer.To
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines how vivid the color for the minimal value will be.
member.remarks: The default value for this property is 0 and the minimal values are show with White color. For instance if the value of this property is 0.1 the minimal values will be shown with a color that is a slight transfusion between the White and the .

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.HeatMap.HeatMapDesaturationColorizer.RangeMinimum
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum of the range with which the colorizer works.
member.remarks: This property is taken into consideration only if its value is not NaN and the property is set to true.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.HeatMap.HeatMapDesaturationColorizer.RangeMaximum
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum of the range with which the colorizer works.
member.remarks: This property is taken into consideration only if its value is not NaN and the property is set to true.

member.summary: Gets or sets the gradient stops. The color for a value is selected to be a transfusion between two colors. These two colors are selected depending on the value of the property. When the property is set to false the Offset is expected to be a relative value, between 0 and 1. When the property is set to true the Offset is expected to be an absolute value. Gradient stops should be ordered in ascending order, according to the values of the Offset property.

member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum of the range with which the colorizer works.
member.remarks: This property is taken into consideration only if its value is not NaN and the property is set to true.

member.name: T:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadHeatMap
member.summary: A data visualization control that represents values in a tabular display. The data is displayed in cells, aligned in rows and columns and each cell has a color that corresponds to the value of the cell. The color of the cell is generated by a . The needs a valid in order to plot the cells and colors correctly.

Returned co-ordinates are in meters, centered on grid square for conversion to latitude/longitude. member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Map.AsyncReaderBase.ExtendedPropertySet
member.summary: Gets or sets extended property set which will be used during shape file (KML or ESRI) reading.
member.remarks: Can be null. In this case extended property set will be created depends on the extended data available in the KML file or in the attributes file (DBF).

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Map.AsyncReaderBase.ToolTipFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets tooltip format. Either ToolTipFormat or ToolTipTemplate should be specified. If both properties are set, then ToolTipTemplate will be used.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Map.AsyncReaderBase.ToolTipTemplate
member.summary: Gets or sets tooltip content template. Either ToolTipFormat or ToolTipTemplate should be specified. If both properties are set, then ToolTipTemplate will be used. You can bind elements in the tooltip template to extended properties using and Data property of the ExtendedData object.
member.example:
This example demonstrates how the tooltip template can be set.
<telerik:AsyncShapeFileReader Source="/Telerik.RadMap.Silverlight;component/africa"> <telerik:AsyncShapeFileReader.ToolTipTemplate> <DataTemplate> <Grid> <Grid.ColumnDefinitions> <ColumnDefinition Width="Auto" /> <ColumnDefinition Width="Auto" /> </Grid.ColumnDefinitions> <Grid.RowDefinitions> <RowDefinition Height="Auto" /> <RowDefinition Height="Auto" /> <RowDefinition Height="Auto" /> </Grid.RowDefinitions>
<TextBlock Grid.Column="0" Grid.Row="0" Text="Name:" /> <TextBlock Grid.Column="1" Grid.Row="0" Text="{Binding Path=Data[CNTRY_NAME]}" />
<TextBlock Grid.Column="0" Grid.Row="1" Text="Population:" /> <TextBlock Grid.Column="1" Grid.Row="1" Text="{Binding Path=Data, Converter={StaticResource ExtendedDataConverter}, ConverterParameter='\{SQKM|#,#.0\}'}" />
<TextBlock Grid.Column="0" Grid.ColumnSpan="2" Grid.Row="2" Text="{Binding Path=Data[Area (MI) \=\{SQMI|F1\} Population\=\{POP_CNTRY|F0\}]}" /> </Grid> </DataTemplate> </telerik:AsyncShapeFileReader.ToolTipTemplate> </telerik:AsyncShapeFileReader> .

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Map.ExtendedDataProvider.ToolTipFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets tooltip format. Either ToolTipFormat or ToolTipTemplate should be specified. If both properties are set, then ToolTipTemplate will be used.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Map.ExtendedDataProvider.ToolTipTemplate
member.summary: Gets or sets tooltip content template. Either ToolTipFormat or ToolTipTemplate should be specified. If both properties are set, then ToolTipTemplate will be used. You can bind elements in the tooltip template to extended properties using Data property of the ExtendedData object.
member.example:
This example demonstrates how the tooltip template can be set.
<DataTemplate x:Key="TooltipTemplate"> <Grid> <Grid.ColumnDefinitions> <ColumnDefinition Width="Auto" /> <ColumnDefinition Width="Auto" /> </Grid.ColumnDefinitions> <Grid.RowDefinitions> <RowDefinition Height="Auto" /> <RowDefinition Height="Auto" /> <RowDefinition Height="Auto" /> </Grid.RowDefinitions>
<TextBlock Grid.Column="0" Grid.Row="0" Text="Name:" /> <TextBlock Grid.Column="1" Grid.Row="0" Text="{Binding Path=Data[Name]}" />
<TextBlock Grid.Column="0" Grid.Row="1" Text="Area:" /> <TextBlock Grid.Column="1" Grid.Row="1" Text="{Binding Path=Data[\{Area|F2\}]}" />
<TextBlock Grid.Column="0" Grid.ColumnSpan="2" Grid.Row="2" Text="{Binding Path=Data[Density\=\{Density|F1\} Population\=\{Population|F0\}]}" /> </Grid> </DataTemplate> .

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Map.VisualizationLayer.UseBitmapCache
member.summary: Gets or sets value which indicates whether bitmap cache should be used to accelerate panning operation.
member.remarks: Using of the bitmap cache significantly increase memory usage when map shapes exists on the layer. We recommend to turn it off for layers with lot of map shapes.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Map.VisualizationLayer.UseDefaultPropertyAccessor
member.summary: Gets or sets value which indicates whether the default (reflection-based) property accessor should be used to access item's map-relative properties (like Location or ZoomRange).
member.remarks: If you set this value to true and do not specify property accessor then default one will be created. Accessing item's properties using accessor is faster then obtaining them from the content presenter bindings. But you should keep in mind that default accessor use some assumptions about data item properties. So if properties of the data items differ from ones are used in default accessor then you should create your own custom data accessor.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Map.BingRestElevationRequest.ElevationType
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of the elevation to be calculated.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Map.BingRestElevationRequest.Points
member.summary: Gets or sets a set of coordinates on the Earth to use in elevation calculations. The exact use of these points depends on the type of elevation request.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Map.BingRestElevationRequest.Bounds
member.summary: Gets or sets the rectangular area over which to provide elevation values.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Map.BingRestElevationRequest.Rows
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of rows to use to divide the bounding box area into a grid. The rows that define the bounding box each count as two (2) of the rows. Elevation values are returned for all vertices of the grid. Integers with a value of two 2 or greater. The number of rows and columns can define a maximum of 1024 locations (rows * cols <= 1024).

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Map.BingRestElevationRequest.Columns
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of columns to use to divide the bounding box area into a grid. The columns that define the bounding box each count as two (2) of the columns. Elevation values are returned for all vertices of the grid. Integers with a value of two 2 or greater. The number of rows and columns can define a maximum of 1024 locations (rows * cols <= 1024).

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Map.BingRestElevationRequest.Samples
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of equally-spaced elevation values to provide along a polyline path. A positive integer. The maximum number of samples is 1024.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Map.BingRestElevationRequest.HeightsType
member.summary: Gets or sets the elevation heights type used in the elevation service request.

member.name: T:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Map.BingRestElevationRequestType
member.summary: The type of the Bing REST elevation request.

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Map.BingRestElevationRequestType.List
member.summary: Get elevations for latitude and longitude coordinates. Required parameters of the : Points.

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Map.BingRestElevationRequestType.Polyline
member.summary: Get elevations at equally-spaced locations along a polyline path. Required parameters of the : Points, Samples.

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Map.BingRestElevationRequestType.Bounds
member.summary: Get elevations at equally-spaced locations within an area on the Earth defined as a bounding box. Required parameters of the : Bounds, Rows, Columns.

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Map.BingRestElevationRequestType.SeaLevel
member.summary: Get the offset of the geoid sea level Earth model from the ellipsoid Earth model at a set of latitude and longitude coordinates. Required parameters of the : Points.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Map.OsmBasedMapProvider.SourceFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets the source format (template for Url to tiles on the map server).
member.example:
This example demonstrates how to bind the provider to the german open street site.
<telerik:RadMap x:Name="radMap"> <telerik:RadMap.Providers> <telerik:OsmBasedMapProvider x:Name="provider" MaxSourceZoomLevel="18" SourceFormat="http://[a,b,c,d].tile.openstreetmap.de/tiles/osmde/{z}/{x}/{y}.png"/> </telerik:RadMap.Providers> </telerik:RadMap>

member.name: T:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Map.VirtualizationLayer
member.summary: Information layer which allows virtualization of the information items depends on the geographical location and zoom factor. In contrast to the InformationLayer which process ALL items in collection this layer request items to process. It makes favor when thousands of items are available (pictures of POIs, for example). Customer application can select what pictures are suitable for given location and zoom factor and returns these ones only.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Map.MapLayer.GetBaseZoomLevel(System.Windows.DependencyObject)
member.summary: Gets value of the attachable BaseZoomLevel property. The BaseZoomLevel affect FrameworkElements (except MapShape based ones.) It specify zoom level where framework element in the information layer have ScaleTransform with scale = 1. If this property is set, then scale transformation will be applied to the framework element when we zoom in/out map control.

member.name: T:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Map.ExtendedDataConverter
member.summary: Value converter to access extended data properties from XAML. 2-way binding can't be specified.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Map.ExtendedDataConverter.Convert(System.Object,System.Type,System.Object,System.Globalization.CultureInfo)
member.summary: Converts a value.
member.param: The value produced by the binding source.
The type of the binding target property.

The converter parameter to use. It can be specified in a few different ways:
Simple name of the extended property.
Formatted extended property. For example: "SUM_SQMI_A|F2". The '|' character is used to separate extended property name and its output format.
Format string which can use number of the extended properties. For example: "{CNTRY_NAME} Miles: {SUM_SQMI_A|F2}, KM: {SUM_SQKM_A|F1}".
The culture to use in the converter.
member.returns: A converted value. If the method returns null (Nothing in Visual Basic), the valid null value is used.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Map.ExtendedDataConverter.ConvertBack(System.Object,System.Type,System.Object,System.Globalization.CultureInfo)
member.summary: Converts a binding target value to the source binding values.
member.param: The value that the binding target produces.
The array of types to convert to. The array length indicates the number and types of values that are suggested for the method to return.
The culture to use in the converter.
member.returns: An array of values that have been converted from the target value back to the source values.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Map.MapShapeReaderBase.ToolTipFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets tooltip format. Either ToolTipFormat or ToolTipTemplate should be specified. If both properties are set, then ToolTipTemplate will be used.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Map.MapShapeReaderBase.ToolTipTemplate
member.summary: Gets or sets tooltip content template. Either ToolTipFormat or ToolTipTemplate should be specified. If both properties are set, then ToolTipTemplate will be used. You can bind elements in the tooltip template to extended properties using and Data property of the ExtendedData object.
member.example:
This example demonstrates how the tooltip template can be set.
<telerik:MapShapeReader Source="/Telerik.RadMap.Silverlight;component/africa"> <telerik:MapShapeReader.ToolTipTemplate> <DataTemplate> <Grid> <Grid.ColumnDefinitions> <ColumnDefinition Width="Auto" /> <ColumnDefinition Width="Auto" /> </Grid.ColumnDefinitions> <Grid.RowDefinitions> <RowDefinition Height="Auto" /> <RowDefinition Height="Auto" /> <RowDefinition Height="Auto" /> </Grid.RowDefinitions>
<TextBlock Grid.Column="0" Grid.Row="0" Text="Name:" /> <TextBlock Grid.Column="1" Grid.Row="0" Text="{Binding Path=Data, Converter={StaticResource ExtendedDataConverter}, ConverterParameter='CNTRY_NAME'}" />
<TextBlock Grid.Column="0" Grid.Row="1" Text="Population:" /> <TextBlock Grid.Column="1" Grid.Row="1" Text="{Binding Path=Data, Converter={StaticResource ExtendedDataConverter}, ConverterParameter='SUM_POP_AD'}" />
<TextBlock Grid.Column="0" Grid.ColumnSpan="2" Grid.Row="2" Text="{Binding Path=Data, Converter={StaticResource ExtendedDataConverter}, ConverterParameter='Miles: {SUM_SQMI_A|F2}, KM: {SUM_SQKM_A|F1}'}" /> </Grid> </DataTemplate> </telerik:MapShapeReader.ToolTipTemplate> </telerik:MapShapeReader> .

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Map.ISpatialReference.AngularUnitOfMeasurement
member.summary: The measurement units used to define the angles of a spheroid or ellipse associated with a specific datum. The datum is usually WGS (World Geodetic System) 1984 and the unit of measurement is a degree.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Map.ISpatialReference.Authority
member.summary: The authority body that defines the standards for the spatial reference parameters. Spatial Reference is usually WGS 1984 and the authority is EPSG:4326.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Map.ISpatialReference.CentralMeridian
member.summary: The line of longitude at the center of a map projection generally used as the basis for constructing the projection.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Map.ISpatialReference.Datum
member.summary: This indicates the horizontal datum, which corresponds to the procedure used to measure positions on the surface of the Earth.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Map.ISpatialReference.DatumAuthority
member.summary: This indicates the horizontal datum, which corresponds to the procedure used to measure positions on the surface of the Earth.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Map.ISpatialReference.FalseEasting
member.summary: The value added to all "x" values in the rectangular coordinate for a map projection. This value frequently is assigned to eliminate negative numbers. Expressed in the unit of measure identified in Planar Coordinate Units.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Map.ISpatialReference.FalseNorthing
member.summary: The value added to all "y" values in the rectangular coordinates for a map projection. This value frequently is assigned to eliminate negative numbers. Expressed in the unit of measure identified in Planar Coordinate Units.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Map.ISpatialReference.GeoGcs
member.summary: A coordinate system based on latitude and longitude. Some geographic coordinate systems are Latitude/Longitude, and some are Longitude/Latitude. You can find out which this is by examining the axes. You should also check the angular units, since not all geographic coordinate systems use degrees.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Map.ISpatialReference.LatitudeOfOrigin
member.summary: The latitude chosen as the origin of rectangular coordinate for a map projection.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Map.ISpatialReference.Primem
member.summary: This defines the meridian used to take longitude measurements from. The units of the longitude must be inferred from the context.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Map.ISpatialReference.PrimemAuthority
member.summary: This defines the meridian used to take longitude measurements from. The units of the longitude must be inferred from the context.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Map.ISpatialReference.ProjectionAuthority
member.summary: This describes a projection from geographic coordinates to projected coordinates.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Map.ISpatialReference.SpheroidRadius
member.summary: This describes a spheroid, which is an approximation of the Earth's surface as a squashed sphere.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Map.ISpatialReference.SpheroidFlattening
member.summary: This describes a spheroid, which is an approximation of the Earth's surface as a squashed sphere.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Map.ISpatialReference.SpheroidAuthority
member.summary: This describes a spheroid, which is an approximation of the Earth's surface as a squashed sphere.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Map.ISpatialReference.StandardParallel
member.summary: The line of constant latitude at which the surface of the Earth and the plane or developable surface intersect.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Map.ISpatialReference.UnitAuthority
member.summary: The authority body that defines the unit of measurement i.e. European Petroleum Survey Group (EPSG). The unit of measurement is usually degrees and the authority for the datum the map uses, WGS 1984 is EPSG:4326.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Map.ISpatialReference.MinLatitude
member.summary: The minimum Latitude this tile source supports.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Map.ISpatialReference.MaxLatitude
member.summary: The maximum Latitude this tile source supports.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Map.ISpatialReference.MinLongitude
member.summary: The minimum Longitude this tile source supports.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Map.ISpatialReference.MaxLongitude
member.summary: The maximum Longitude this tile source supports.

member.summary: Calculate size of rectangle from base point.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Map.SpatialReference.AngularUnitOfMeasurement
member.summary: Gets or sets the measurement units used to define the angles of a spheroid or ellipse associated with a specific datum. The datum is WGS 1984 and the unit of measurement is a degree.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Map.SpatialReference.Authority
member.summary: Gets or sets the authority body that defines the standards for the spatial reference parameters. The Spatial Reference is WGS 1984 and the authority is EPSG:4326.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Map.SpatialReference.CentralMeridian
member.summary: Gets or sets the line of longitude at the center of a map projection generally used as the basis for constructing the projection.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Map.SpatialReference.Datum
member.summary: Gets or sets the horizontal datum, which corresponds to the procedure used to measure positions on the surface of the Earth.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Map.SpatialReference.DatumAuthority
member.summary: Gets or sets the horizontal datum, which corresponds to the procedure used to measure positions on the surface of the Earth.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Map.SpatialReference.FalseEasting
member.summary: Gets or sets value added to all "x" values in the rectangular coordinate for a map projection. This value frequently is assigned to eliminate negative numbers. Expressed in the unit of measure identified in Planar Coordinate Units.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Map.SpatialReference.FalseNorthing
member.summary: Gets or sets value added to all "y" values in the rectangular coordinates for a map projection. This value frequently is assigned to eliminate negative numbers. Expressed in the unit of measure identified in Planar Coordinate Units.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Map.SpatialReference.GeoGcs
member.summary: Gets or sets coordinate system based on latitude and longitude. Some geographic coordinate systems are Latitude/Longitude, and some are Longitude/Latitude. You can find out which this is by examining the axes. You should also check the angular units, since not all geographic coordinate systems use degrees.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Map.SpatialReference.LatitudeOfOrigin
member.summary: Gets or sets the latitude chosen as the origin of rectangular coordinate for a map projection.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Map.SpatialReference.OffsetX
member.summary: Gets or sets logical X offset to centre of earth.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Map.SpatialReference.OffsetY
member.summary: Gets or sets logical Y offset to centre of earth.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Map.SpatialReference.Primem
member.summary: Gets or sets the meridian used to take longitude measurements from. The units of the longitude must be inferred from the context.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Map.SpatialReference.PrimemAuthority
member.summary: Gets or sets the meridian used to take longitude measurements from. The units of the longitude must be inferred from the context.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Map.SpatialReference.ProjectionAuthority
member.summary: Gets or sets a projection from geographic coordinates to projected coordinates.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Map.SpatialReference.ScaleX
member.summary: Gets or sets the real world coordinate scale at a given longitude.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Map.SpatialReference.ScaleY
member.summary: Gets or sets the real world coordinate scale at a given latitude.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Map.SpatialReference.SpheroidRadius
member.summary: Gets or sets a spheroid, which is an approximation of the Earth's surface as a squashed sphere.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Map.SpatialReference.SpheroidFlattening
member.summary: Gets or sets a spheroid, which is an approximation of the Earth's surface as a squashed sphere.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Map.SpatialReference.SpheroidAuthority
member.summary: Gets or sets a spheroid, which is an approximation of the Earth's surface as a squashed sphere.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Map.SpatialReference.StandardParallel
member.summary: Gets or sets the line of constant latitude at which the surface of the Earth and the plane or developable surface intersect.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Map.SpatialReference.UnitAuthority
member.summary: Gets or sets the authority body that defines the unit of measurement i.e. European Petroleum Survey Group (EPSG). The unit of measurement is usually degrees and the authority for the datum the map uses, WGS 1984 is EPSG:4326.

member.summary: Gets or sets numeric format string will be used to replace {zoom} placeholder. For example "D2" will replace {zoom} placeholder with 2 digits integer (01, 02, ..., 19). The default value is null, which produce simple integer without paddings (1, 2, ... 9, 10, ... 19).

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.TimeBarBase.ActualMinZoomRange
member.summary: Gets the actual .
member.remarks: By default, the size of the content element is restricted to 30000 pixels. This restriction is enforced by specifying a minimum zoom range using the property. In case is specified, that is, its value is not , its value is set to the property and the default behavior is overwritten. However, in Silverlight, due to a limitation in the framework, the 30000 pixel restriction is respected even in case a small value is specified for the property.

member.name: T:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Map.DynamicLayer
member.summary: Information layer which allows virtualization of the information items depends on the geographical location and zoom factor. In contrast to StaticLayer which process ALL items in collection this layer request items to process. It makes favor when thousands of items are available (pictures of POIs, for example). Customer application can select what pictures are suitable for given location and zoom factor and returns these ones only.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Map.MapShape.CaptionLocation
member.summary: Gets or sets the location of the map shape caption.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Map.MapShape.CaptionTemplate
member.summary: Gets or sets caption content template. You can bind elements in the caption template to extended properties using and Data property of the ExtendedData object.
member.example:
This example demonstrates how the caption template can be set.
<telerik:MapPolygon Points="56,-100 56,-108 48,-108 48,-100" Fill="Green" Stroke="Red" StrokeThickness="4" CaptionLocation="52,-104"> <telerik:MapPolygon.CaptionTemplate> <DataTemplate> <Grid Background="Yellow" telerik:MapLayer.HotSpot="0.5,0.5"> <TextBlock Text="{Binding Path=Data, Converter={StaticResource ExtendedDataConverter}, ConverterParameter='CNTRY_NAME'}" /> </Grid> </DataTemplate> </telerik:MapPolygon.CaptionTemplate> </telerik:MapPolygon> .
